text: Martin Kučera (born 10 May 1990 in Bratislava) is a Slovak athlete specialising in the 400 metres hurdles. He won the gold medal at the 2013 Summer Universiade. His personal best in the event is 49.08 seconds set in Amsterdam in 2016. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2012 |European Championships |Helsinki, Finland |25th (h) |400 m hurdles |51.50 |- |2013 |Universiade |Kazan, Russia |bgcolor=gold|1st |400 m hurdles |49.79 |- |rowspan=2|2016 |European Championships |Amsterdam, Netherlands |7th |400 m hurdles |49.82 |- |Olympic Games |Rio de Janeiro, Brazil |44th (h) |400 m hurdles |51.47 |- |2018 |European Championships |Berlin, Germany |18th (sf) |400 m hurdles |50.30 |} ==References== == External links == * Martin Kučera at the Slovenský Olympijský Výbor * Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:Slovak male hurdlers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2015 European Games Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Slovakia Category:Sportspeople from Bratislava Category:Universiade medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Universiade gold medalists for Slovakia Category:European Games silver medalists for Slovakia Category:European Games medalists in athletics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2019 European Games Category:European Games competitors for Slovakia Category:Medalists at the 2013 Summer Universiade
title: Martin Kučera
